p: The levels of blood urea, uric acid, creatinine, and blood urea nitrogen (BUN) were found to be significantly elevated ( p < 0.01) in rats that were treated with Cd only (3 mg/kg, IP) for 7 days. However, administration of TSA oil and silymarin in Cd-intoxicated rats substantially improved the Cd-induced kidney damage as specified by suppressed levels of blood urea, uric acid, creatinine, and BUN ( Figure 1Aâ€“D).
